intro: Cynoglossum robustum, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Cynoglossum robustum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
